msItem.title: Services for various Feasts, Saints' Days, etc.
msItem.note: A full service comprises ܨܠܘܬܐ, ܦܪܘܡܝܘܢ, ܣܕܪܐ, ܥܛܪܐ, and ܚܘܬܡܐ.

msItem.title: Second order.
msItem.note: It is imperfect at the beginning.

msItem.title: Sixth order.
msItem.note: It is Imperfect at the end.

msItem.title: Seventh order.
msItem.note: It is imperfect at the beginning.

msItem.title: The Commemoration of the twelve Apostles.
The Commemoration of Addai or Thaddaeus.
The Commemoration of Macarius, Bishoi or Pisoes, John the Less, Maximus, and Domitius.
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܐܒܐ ܡ̇ܰܩܰܪܻܝܣ ܘܐܒܐ ܒܻܝܫܳܘܝ ܘܐܒܐ ܝܘܼܚܢܢ ܙܥܘܼܪܐ ܘܡ̇ܰܟܣܝܺܡܳܘܣ ܘܕܽܘܡܶܛܻܝܳܘܣ

msItem.title: The Decease of the blessed Virgin.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܥܠ ܫܽܘܢܳܝܳܗ̇ ܕܝ̇ܳܠܕܰܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ ܡܪܝܡ

msItem.title: The Invention of the holy Cross.
msItem.note: It is imperfect both at the beginning and the end.

msItem.title: The Commemoration of any one Ascetic.
Another service for the Commemoration of all Martyrs, but specially of such as Sergius and Bacchus.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܐܚܪܢܐ ܕܣ̈ܗܕܐ܇ ܘܚ̇ܫܚ ܠܡܪܝ ܣܪܓܝܣ ܘܒܐܟܘܣ ܘܕܐܟܘܬܗܘܢ

msItem.title: The Commemoration of Isaiah of Aleppo.
Of Mār Simeon and Mār Samuel of Kartamīn.
msItem.rubric: ܣܕܪܐ ܥܠ ܡܪܝ ܫܡ̣ܥܘܢ ܘܡܪܝ ܫܡ̣ܘܐܝܠ ܕܥܘܼܡܪܐ ܕܩܲܪܬܡܝܢ

msItem.title: Of Philoxenus of Mabūg.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܩ̇ܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܦܻܝܠܳܠܘܟܣܶܢܳܘܣ ܐ܏ܦܝܣ ܕܡܲܰܐܒܽܘܓ.

msItem.title: Of Malchus, the nephew of Eugenius.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܡܲܰܠܟܶܐ ܒܪ ܚܬܗ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܶܘܓܺܝܢ

msItem.title: Of Febronia and other female martyrs.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܥܠ ܣܗܕܬܐ ܦܶܒܪܽܘܢܺܝܰܐ. ܘܥܠ ܫܲܪܟܐ ܕܢܫ̈ܐ ܣܗ̈ܕܬܐ

msItem.title: Of S. Peter and S. Paul.
Of Cyriacus the martyr, S. Andrew the Apostle, and Abhai, bishop of Nicaea.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܚ̈ܘܣ̣ܝܐ ܕܥܠ ܣ̇ܗܕܐ ܢܲܨܝܚܐ ܡܪܝ ܩܘܪܝܩܘܣ. ܘܥܠ ܡܪܝ ܐܢܕܪܐܣ ܫܠܝ̣ܚܐ. ܘܡܪܝ ܐܰܒܚܰܝ ܐܦܝܣ̣ܩܦܐ

msItem.title: Of the Maccabees, viz. Shamūnī, her sons, and their teacher Eleazar.
msItem.rubric: ܕܥܠ ܡܪܬܝ ܫܡܘܢܝ ܘܒ̈ܢܝܗ̇ ܘܐܠܝ̣ܥܙܪ ܡܲܠܦܢܗܘܢ
msItem.note: The sedrā is by Jacob (or Dionysius) bar Salībī, bishop of Amid: ܣܝ̣ܡ ܠܒܪܨܠܝܒܝ ܕܗ̣ܘ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܐܦܝܣܩܦܐ ܕܐܰܡܝܺܕ.

msItem.title: Of the martyrs Sergius and Bacchus.
Of the martyrs Agrippas and Laurentius.
Of the martyrs Barbara and Juliana.
Of the martyr Behnām.
msItem.rubric: ܕܥܠ ܣ̇ܗܕܐ ܚܠܝ̣ܨܐ ܘܐܬܠܝ̣ܛܐ ܙܪܝ̣ܙܐ ܘܢ̇ܨ̣ܝܚܐ ܡܪܝ ܒ݊ܗ݊ܢ݊ܡ ܛܘܼܒܢܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܬܦܲܫܩ ܫܲܦܝܪ ܫܡܐ

msItem.title: The Festival of the holy Cross.
msItem.note: The prooemium (ܦܪܘܡܝܘܣ) is by Abū Sa'īd bar Sabūnī: ܐܡܝ̣ܪ ܠܐܒܘܣܝܥܝܕ ܒܪ ܨܒܘܼܢܝ.

item.p: Paper, about 12 3/4 in. by 8 5/8, consisting of 222 leaves, some of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 1, 31, 59, 68, 96, 107, 118, 221, and 222. The quires, signed with letters, were originally 24 in number, but the first two have been lost. A single leaf is wanting after fol. 31, and another after fol. 168; and nearly the whole of fol. 145 has been torn out. Each page is divided into two columns of 25 lines.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written, by two persons, in a neat, regular character, with numerous Greek vowels (%) . Syriac vowels and the points rukkākh and kushshāI are more rare.
The writer of the latter portion (foll. 169 —222) does not mention his name.

item.p: On the margin of fol. 68 b we find the following note, relating to the service for the Friday of Gold.

p.quote: ܒܥܝ̣ ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܪܘܒܬܐ ܕܕܗܒܐ ܕܗܘܿܝܐ ܒ݁ܬܪ ܚܕܒܫܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܦܢܛܝܩܘܣܛܝ. ܒܪܘܫܡܐ ܕܡܢܝܢܐ ܠ܏ܚ.

item.p: The sedra in this service is by Abraham of Chabūr, as appears from the acrostic, fol. 202 a.
The colophon states that this book was written A. Gr. 1795, A.D. 1484, in the convent of S. Mary Deipara.

p.quote: ܘܗܠܝܢ ܫܢܬ ܐ܏ܥܨܗ ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܒܗ̇ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܡܬܟܲܢܝܐ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܣܘܼܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܡܨܪܝܢ ܐܘܟܝܬ ܫܵܗܝܲܬ݀ ܬ݀ܩܠ ܠܒܐ ܡܣܐܬܐ ܕܚܘܼܫ̈ܒܐ. ܒܐܝ̈ܕܝ ܐܢܫ ܚܠܫܐ ܘܣܢܝ̣ܩ ܥܠ ܪ̈ܚܡ܏ܘ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܒܨܝ̣ܪܐ ܒܒܢ̈ܝ ܐܢܫܐ ܘܚܛܝܐ ܒܟܠ ܡܘ̈ܡܝܢ ܘܚ̈ܫܝܢ ܕܚܛܝ̣ܬܐ. ܕܣ̣ܪܛ ܘܚܲܒܠ ܗܠܝܢ ܏ܟܟ ܣܕܪ̈ܐ ܐܚܪ̈ܝܐ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܫܘܬܦܘܬܐ. ܘܥܘܼܗܕܢܐ ܢܛܝܪܐ ܠܥܠܡ. ܒܒܥܘ ܏ܘܫ.

item.p: The former portion was written by one Jacob, as appears from the subscription on fol. 24 b.

p.quote: ܗܪܟܐ ܨܲܠܐ ܥܠ ܕܘܿܝܐ. ܚܲܛܝܐ ܝܥܩܘܼܒ ܥܒ̣ܕܟ. ܘܟܬ݂ܒ ܐܝܟ ܚܲܝܠܗ ܠܟ̣ܬܒܟ. ܐܠܗܐ ܚܲܣܐ ܠܗ ܚܘ̈ܒܘܗܝ.

item.p: There are ornamental devices at the commencement of some of the services; e.g. foll. 2 b, 10 b, 16 b, 25 a, 40 b, 51 a, and 77 a. Blue paint has been used in writing one of the rubrics, fol. 7 b.

revisionDesc.change: The Syriac copied from the Word Document needs to be checked for accuracy
Add in missing Greek characters. (Condition Desc)
